actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed:  S.Hrg. 99-618.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed:  S.Hrg. 99-618.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Roth with an amendment and an amendment to the title. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 811.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from CBO.

official_title: A bill to extend and revise the authority of the President under chapter 9 of title 5, United States Code, to transmit to the Congress plans for the reorganization of the agencies of the executive branch of the Government.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Governmental Affairs with amendment (without written report)) Reorganization Act Amendments of 1986 - Extends the authority of the President to reorganize the executive branch until December 31, 1988 (currently, December 31, 1984). Revises the congressional veto procedure to conform to such extension.

titles.title: A bill to extend and revise the authority of the President under chapter 9 of title 5, United States Code, to transmit to the Congress plans for the reorganization of the agencies of the executive branch of the Government.
